page.title: 14Farming in Walsden (Part 2)
page.content: The types of farms described in part one generally means that the local farmer needs government assistance. 'Hill cows' attract a subsidy of Â£45 per year if it has a calf, therefore a farmer will quickly sell off an ailing animal. Hill sheep get a subsidy of Â£4.50 for every breeding ewe. The average selling price for a milking cow is Â£500 and a sheep will bring about Â£50 at the market. Farming in Walsden is going through a period of severe decline. The average acreage in the area is in the region of 45 to 50 acres.
